title: Use e-Tickets
intro: You can save money for every flight/train you take by using an e-ticket, and more importantly, help save the planet by reducing paper waste.

title: Start a compost pile
intro: Compost is an incredible way to improve the soil in your your garden. It's also free, easy to maintain, and good for the environment.

title: Adjust your energy use
intro: Adjust your thermostat, hot water heater, and refridgerator to more energy efficient temperatures to improve your home's sustainability.

title: Rely on fans in the winter
intro: Constant eating requires significantly more energy than heating supplemented by regular fans, where fans could actually provide a similar effect with less energy used.

title: Use renewable energy
intro: Invest in more renewable energy sources (clean electricity) to benefit the environment as well as your wallet in the long run.

title: Reduce water consumption
intro: Use a car wash service rather than washing your own car to ensure minimized water usage.

title: Have more vegetarian meals
intro: Though you may not want to end meat consumption entirely, having fewer meals with meat can help reduce water consumption due to its production and even help preserve forests!

title: Use fewer napkins/paper towels
intro: Though we may not use many napkins in one meal, it adds up, so reducing this type of waste is important. Consider switching to cloth napkins, and you could help reduce landfill volume significantly.

title: Sustainable transport
intro: Since you live close to your place of work/study, consider biking or walking rather than fuel-based transport. Not only will this reduce your carbon emissions, it'll improve your health!

title: Use sustainable transport
intro: Consider more public transport like buses or trains rather than travelling by car (it makes a huge difference). If car is the only available method of transport, try carpooling more to help save gas.
